newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigerian VAT collection exceeds annual target.
newsitem.headline: Nigerian VAT collection exceeds annual target.

text.p: Nigeria's value added tax (VAT) stood at 22.2 billion naira at the end of September, more than the annual target of 22 billion naira for the year, the national news agency reported on Tuesday.

The News Agency of Nigeria quoted figures from the tax department showing that, while about 8.6 billion naira was collected in the third quarter alone, yield for the first and second quarters were 6.3 and 7.3 billion naira, respectively.
It said if the yield pattern, indicating an upward trend in each successive quarter was maintained, about 30 billion naira would be realised by the end of the year.
VAT was introduced in 1994 to boost government revenue outside crude oil exports. A total of 20.436 billion naira was collected as VAT in 1995. ($1=80)
